title: unstable_handleError cause an unmountComponent of null error.
body:
**Do you want to request a *feature* or report a *bug*?** _bug_ **What is the current behavior?** I'm trying to handle errors that happens in the render method, for example: ``` import React from 'react' export default class TestCompoent from React.Component { constructor() { super() this.state = { bar: foo } } render() { return (
{this.state.foo.bar}
) } } ``` this component will return an error TypeError: Cannot read property 'bar' of null. I know I can handle this with selectors and proper tests etc.. but my aim is to dispatch an action when the exception happens and redirect to a certain page. I've tried to use the function unstable_handleError like this ``` .... unstable_handleError(e) { //function to dispatch this.props.functionToDispatch(e) browserHistory.push('/foobarErrorPage') return null //I've tried different type of return with no luck } ... ``` But I receive another error which is: ``` ReactCompositeComponent.js:328 Uncaught TypeError: Cannot read property 'unmountComponent' of null at ReactCompositeComponentWrapper.performInitialMountWithErrorHandling (webpack:///./~/react-dom/lib/ReactCompositeComponent.js?:328:32) at ReactCompositeComponentWrapper.mountComponent (webpack:///./~/react-dom/lib/ReactCompositeComponent.js?:256:21) at Object.mountComponent (webpack:///./~/react-dom/lib/ReactReconciler.js?:46:35) at ReactCompositeComponentWrapper.performInitialMount (webpack:///./~/react-dom/lib/ReactCompositeComponent.js?:373:34) at ReactCompositeComponentWrapper.mountComponent (webpack:///./~/react-dom/lib/ReactCompositeComponent.js?:258:21) at Object.mountComponent (webpack:///./~/react-dom/lib/ReactReconciler.js?:46:35) at ReactDOMComponent.mountChildren (webpack:///./~/react-dom/lib/ReactMultiChild.js?:238:44) at ReactDOMComponent._createInitialChildren (webpack:///./~/react-dom/lib/ReactDOMComponent.js?:691:32) at ReactDOMComponent.mountComponent (webpack:///./~/react-dom/lib/ReactDOMComponent.js?:516:12) at Object.mountComponent (webpack:///./~/react-dom/lib/ReactReconciler.js?:46:35) **If the current behavior is a bug, please provide the steps to reproduce and if possible a minimal demo of the problem via https://jsfiddle.net or similar (template: https://jsfiddle.net/reactjs/69z2wepo/).** ``` The only solution that I found is to have a try... catch block in the render function, but I don't like it. So I'm hoping to find a better solution. **What is the expected behavior?** _Dispatch the action and redirect to the page that I want_ **Which versions of React, and which browser / OS are affected by this issue? Did this work in previous versions of React?** _React 15.3.2 React-DOM 15.3.2 redux 3.6.0 Google Chrome macOS Sierra_
